item.title: KCP and Wirehair
item.description: KCP and Wirehair are both used in networking to improve data transmission, but they serve different purposes and are suited for different scenarios. Before diving into details, here is a quick overview: KCP Wirehair type reliable ARQ Fountain code (FEC) best for real-time, low latency apps high packet loss, one-to-many broadcasts latency optimized encoding/decoding latency packet loss retransmission (ARQ) forward error correction (FEC) use case gaming, live streaming multicast streaming overhead 10-20% bandwidth depends on FEC redundancy ordering preserved no inherent ordering feedback requires ACKS for reliability no feedback needed KCP Link to heading KCP is a fast ans reliable ARQ (Automatic Repeat-reQuest) protocol typically implemented over UDP.
